intro: Pycnandra neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of the region. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Pycnandra neocaledonica is notable for its ecological significance and is often found in the understory of dense forest ecosystems.
